instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no logical activity
threads.message:
Good morning, I have a mac that came with fan spin, but it won't start.
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> : stucked on 1.1V
I've tried another BIOS, but without success. I've tried other RAM memories too and found small oxidations on the contacts of the memory slots, I cleaned them but nothing changed.
I noticed that after testing with a good BIOS, the mac did not recognize the RAM memories at times, displaying an individual beep, as if there were no memories installed. I tested good memories individually in each slot, but the beeps are intermittent. With or without beeps, <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> is still locked at 1.1V
 Do you have any suggestions? Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no logical activity
threads.message:
Any history fault available?
Test the RAM slots with DDR3 test card.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no logical activity
threads.message:
No history available.
I don't own a RAM slots tester. Can you recommend a quality one to buy?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no logical activity
threads.message: eBay, or Aliexpress; quality is question of luck there...
